Blog.post: So Guy sent me an email bitching about an encyclopedia entry that he has to edit for this comprehensive encyclopedia of folklore (from 20,000 words to 5000), and it reminded me of these two really cool websites, that bring being-an-authority-on-something to the masses: 1) urlLink Wikipedia : This is an online encyclopedia that's free, and updatable. You can simply click on edit and fix any errors on the site in html. You can also see revision histories for all of the files, and links to articles that need to be written. Pretty interesting that no one person oversees it, but that it gets overseen and corrected by the network itself. Hypertexted, you can sit an follow links on this thing forever. "Wiki" incidentally is a Hawaiian word which means "super-fast" refering to the speed of editing (essentially in real time). 2) urlLink H2G2 : The guide to life, the universe, and everything predates wikipedia by about a year, and some of the original boss-type guys jumped ship and came to wiki. This site is more about community building, and includes opinion pieces and random stuff. Check out this story on urlLink cargo cults . Obviously I had several patient cancellations this morning....

And you should too. 1) urlLink This Modern World. Tom Tommorrow's out, but Bob Harris writes some pretty topical stuff. 2) urlLink die puny humans "The filthy monkey, it plans."
